subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0041_01C9BAAD.D88D7EB0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I have never had that happen LOL!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: =
senecaripple90 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, April 11, =
2009 1:26 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hun=
ter stuff.





  and no evil spirits or poltegeist visited you as george n=
oory suggested or warned us about when playing with the ouija board?

  ---=
 In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  >=
 Exactly. And it may even be that it's both-sometimes it is us, but once in=
 a while and actual entity comes through. But until I can really study it o=
ver a period time, I am just not convinced either way.
  > 
  > ----- Origi=
nal Message ----- 
  > From: Zack Widup 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
 =
 > Sent: Saturday, April 11, 2009 1:10 AM
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alt=
ernative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  >=
 I tried an Ouija board once. My brother and I were given one by my grandmo=
ther, who found it in her attic. After asking many questions and getting al=
l sorts of answers that ranged from gibberish to the totally absurd, I thin=
k we decided there was something in our joint subconsciouses that was makin=
g the planchette give the answers it did.
  > 
  > That may not always be t=
he case, though. I think if answers of some sort were given involving somet=
hing that no one present would have the faintest idea about, and they turne=
d out to be true or valid, then it might demonstrate spirit communication.
=
  > 
  > Zack
  > 
  > 
  > On Fri, Apr 10, 2009 at 11:37 PM, April Abercro=
mbie <april@...> wrote:
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > Well, if my husband wo=
uld let me actually experiment with one, that would be the first step LOL!
=
  > 
  > But what I would try and do is get some kind of verifiable informa=
tion from the "entity" that I contact with the board to prove that it is co=
mmunication from an actual, intelligent being and not just my own motor res=
ponses making he planchette move. It would have to be information that I ha=
ve no knowledge of.
  > 
  > If I could do that, and consistently, then I w=
ould be comfortable saying that I am actually talking to a spirit.
  > 
  >=
 The reason I have my doubts is that you have to be touching the planchette=
 to get it to move. If it were an actual spirit, I would think that shouldn=
't be necessary. We all know ghosts can a do move objects.
  > 
  > But thi=
s brings up another mystery - if the Ouija board is actual spirit communica=
tion, maybe there is a difference between the entities you can contact with=
 it and your common ghost.
  > 
  > April
  > 
  > ----- Original Message -=
---- 
  > From: lori bogren 
  > To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Fri=
day, April 10, 2009 9:50 PM
  > Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to th=
e usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > April~
  > 
  > Hm, finally I'm i=
ntrigued again.
  > 
  > How do you about the process?
  > 
  > ~Lori
  > 
=
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > "My life is boring, my fantasies are a theme park." 
  >=
 --Anne Rice Responding to an interviewer who just did not get it. 
  > 
  =
> 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > --------------------------------------=
--------------------
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  > From: april@...
  =
> Date: Fri, 10 Apr 2009 18:36:30 -0600
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alter=
native to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
  > 
  > .
  > 
  > 
  > When =
it comes to the Ouija, I just want to study it to find out if it is really =
spirit communication, or just kinetic energy or your subconscious mind movi=
ng the planchette.
  > 
  > I agree that we all have the ability for extra =
sensory perception, just some are better at it than others. Like running, f=
or instance. We all can run, but some are naturally better at it. Still, wi=
th practice we can get better.
  > 
  > But that is not my aim with the Oui=
ja.
  > 
  > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: lori bogren 
  > =
To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Friday, April 10, 2009 6:11 PM
  > S=
ubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
  > 
=
  > 
  > April~
  > 
  > You forgot yawn from boredom, that's what I do.
  =
> 
  > Use it, don't use it. I don't care. But why bother. When people ask =
me I usually suggest that if they want to communicate with ... whatever why=
 not develop the ability yourself. - ya, I'm one of those who believe anyon=
e can.
  > 
  > There's always the question in the back of your mind whethe=
r your partner's moving it. The intentions of "what" you are talking to. No=
t to mention it's too slow and limited.
  > 
  > Besides if you take the ti=
me to develop the ability you can get more texture in the information. Aski=
ng the board "where you married?" may get you a "yes" but a psychic might g=
et the sense of a religious or civil ceremonhy, the garment(s) worn, other'=
s in the party, or whether that Being approved/disapproved of their spouse =
(ie was it a reluctant union).
  > 
  > ~Lori 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  >
